title: The Glass-Walker's Path
description: A 'Glass-Walker'—a traveler who can walk on any surface—is stuck in a 'Mirror-Loop' in the North-Ward.

turns.narrative: The Mirror-Loop is a zone where every window and puddle acts as a portal. The Glass-Walker is a man in a coat of silver-scales, frantically jumping from his reflection in a baker's shop to a reflection in a rain-barrel. He's trapped in a ten-second loop of his own panic.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You shatter the baker's window, and the Walker falls into the real world. (+1 Progress)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You slow the transitions, giving him time to breathe. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Walker's reflections begin to detach and walk on the walls of the street.

turns.narrative: There are now six Glass-Walkers, all screaming in synchronized harmony. They are trying to 'Pull the World into the Glass'.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You spot the one whose scales are slightly tarnished. (+1 Progress)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The reflections are blinded and retreat into the shadows. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: The street begins to turn into a material as fragile as glass—with every step, you hear a crack beneath your boots.

turns.narrative: A 'Refraction-Horror'—a entity made of thousand-faceted diamonds—emerges from a puddle. It's beautiful and sharp, its movements a light-show of lethal intensity.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You chip away its symmetry. (+1 Progress)
turns.choice_b: Use a mirror to reflect its own beam (Dex DC 15)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The Horror is blinded by its own light. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Glass-Walker hands you his 'Silver-Sandal'. 'Step where I step!' he cries.

turns.narrative: With the Silver-Sandal, the 'Glass-World' becomes visible. You are walking on a bridge of light over an abyss of 'Raw-Data'.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You reach the 'Mirror-Core'—a floating, hexagonal prism. (+1 Progress)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You see the 'Code' of the city's foundation. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: A 'Reflection-Stalker'—a shadow made of broken glass—appears behind you.

turns.narrative: The Stalkers are trying to trip you into the abyss. Their touch is cold and leaves 'Glass-Splinters' in your mind.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You resist the identity-drain. (+100 XP)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You cut off their pursuit. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: You reach the Mirror-Core. It's humming with the sound of a thousand people talking at once.

turns.narrative: The Core is a 'Logic-Vault'—it's storing the memories of the North-Ward. It's been 'Corrupted' by a 'Void-Worm'.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You pull the purple parasite from the clockwork. (+1 Loot)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The memories return to their owners. (+10 Morale)
turns.convergence: The Mirror-Loop collapses. You and the Walker fall back onto the cobblestones of the North-Ward.

turns.narrative: The Glass-Walker is unconscious, his coat of scales now dull and gray. He's clutching a 'Mirror-Compass'.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You gain a tool that points to the nearest rift. (+1 Gear)
turns.consequence_b: Success: He thanks you and offers to be your 'Scout'. (+5 Reputation)
turns.convergence: A 'Glass-Sanitizer' squad from the High-Ward arrives, carrying steam-hoses and iron-hammers.

turns.narrative: They want to 'Shatter' the whole street to ensure the loop is truly gone.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You protect the residents' property. (+5 Morale)
turns.consequence_b: Success: They only break the necessary windows. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: You find a 'Shard of True-Memory' in the debris.

turns.narrative: The Shard shows you a vision of a 'Glass-City' beneath the ice of the North-Pass.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You have a new destination. (+1 Lore)
turns.choice_b: Give the Shard to the Chronicle Weaver
turns.consequence_b: Success: He gives you 'The Weaver's Glass-Eye'. (+1 Rare Item)
turns.convergence: The North-Ward is safe for now, the windows once again reflecting only the sky.

turns.narrative: You walk away from the street. Every time you pass a mirror, you check to see if your reflection is still following. So far, it is.
turns.choice_a: Accept a bag of silver coins
turns.consequence_a: Success: You are paid 850 gold. (+850 Gold)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You dream of a world made of diamonds. (+1 Luck)

conclusion: The Glass-Walker's Path was a leak from the 'Mirror-Plane'. The loop is closed, but the 'Refraction-Horror' suggests a larger geometry is at work.

risk_matrix.penalty: Street becomes 'Fragile'. -2 Defense and a permanent risk of 'Glass-Cuts' (-5 Health) for anyone walking here.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor consequences.

unlock_conditions.trigger: North-Ward reports windows acting as portals
